title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: I applied and immediately received an email to schedule an interview. Since we were still at the end stages of the lockdown, I was asked my availability to do an interview over the phone.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: You apply, and if you meet qualifications you will be invited to an interview. I had met the qualifications and was asked to interview. It did take some time to get back to me for an interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in advising?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Easy, simple. Job is down to earth, helping students follow guidance and safety rules in the laboratory. You must be a student to apply for this position. Easy, simple. Job is down to earth, helping students follow guidance and safety rules in the laboratory. You must be a student to apply for this position.
Interview Questions: Easy, simple. Job is down to earth, helping students follow guidance and safety rules in the laboratory. You must be a student to apply for this position. Easy, simple. Job is down to earth, helping students follow guidance and safety rules in the laboratory. You must be a student to apply for this position.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Must be enrolled full time to work. Interview was short and minimal experience was needed. Interview mostly involves questions about availability. Interviewer describes job responsibilities thoroughly. Recent change in management.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work weekends?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The emailed you if you got the interview for the position. After that they give you the steps required throughout the process. They get back to you in less than a week after the interview if you got it or not.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself? What is one of your greatest or recent accomplishments? Three words to describe yourself? How would you approach someone that talks to you in an aggressive manner? Why do you think you’re a good fit for this position? What is your strength and weakness?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick and easy. They were open to hiring me with little experience and had a fast turnaround to a job offer which i ended up accepting.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in customer service?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and professional. Extreme friendly and understanding group of people that made the whole process seem relaxed. They were knowledgeable and the three interviews went smoothly despite the outcome!
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had to resolve conflict

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Someone from the department reached out to schedule a call between the hiring personnel, direct supervisor and the head of the department. The interview lasted about an hour with each individual asking specific questions on research experience, working style, and knowledge of the department. They left some time at the end of the interview where you could ask some questions to the panel.
Interview Questions: What experience would you highlight that best relates to this position?

title: Student Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Individual interview process in which the two supervisors ask generic interview questions (Ie. what skills are your strengths? weaknesses?) The interviewers were really nice and conversational and it was not intimidating at all aside the interview jitters than many people get.
Interview Questions: What are your personal strengths ?

title: Web Dev Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Amazing interview at the company, you can actually know how the company works and also you are able to explain yourself properly in an interview. I would recommend people apply. I just got another offer hence i didn't join.
Interview Questions: Some basic questions related to front end

title: Ticket Seller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. The interview was conducted over zoom and had a panel of 2 people as my interviewers. They asked me quite a few questions which include behavioral and situational questions.
Interview Questions: Do you like working in a team or independently?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Great questions were asked during the stages of interviews. Friendly and welcoming zoom environment. My experience of two part interview. One with your direct supervisor and then second with team +HR. On time and did not go over assigned time.
Interview Questions: When was a time you made a mistake at your workplace and how did you handle it?

title: Department Financial Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted 2 weeks later for a zoom interview. Interview was with 4 people since the position would be supporting 2 departments. Questions were straight forward for a college job. In the job description it said it was a new job when I mentioned it I was quickly cut off explaining that the job had been there a few years. When I asked why the previous person left they said they quit. This is already a red flag for me since I was rudely interrupted before I can even finish my question and received a hostile response after that. CSUN is a great school but not somewhere I would want to work.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with financial analysis?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: This interview was pretty easy and straightforward, I was asked basic questions. There was only one scenario question. This was a one on one interview held at my job. I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions:
Why should we hire you?
What skills do you have that you can bring to the team?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very Basic. Be sure to take your resume and be ready to answer questions. Make sure you are presentable. Be sure to ask questions to the interviewer.  Do your research on the job you are applying to, everyone is friendly.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for your position?

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: I met with one of the senior lead ushers (none student full-time worker), they asked me some questions about my schedule and my availability, and my plans for the future. I then had a secondary interview after that one with the house manager, who was very nice and welcoming. He asked me more specific questions about how I would work in a team situation and how I would deal with conflict with a customer or another employee.
Interview Questions: Can you think of a situation where you have had to deal with a customer service issue, if so, how did you deal with it?

title: Marketing Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: job was posted on the usu website, applied for the job back in march but hiring was stopped due to covid so i ended up only getting interviewed in late August
Interview Questions: do a 15 second promotional clip explaining why we should hire you

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: I was introduced to a few people around the office before the interview. It was a group interview with 3 other people interviewing me. The interview seemed to have gone well but I later found out that they already had a candidate in mind for the job-the interviews were just policy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Tutor/Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: They just asked for me to come in because i had good grades in the courses needing some extra help, they introduced me to the responsibilities and asked very straightforward questions, then signed me up on the spot.
Interview Questions: Basic questions, rating myself 1-10 on things like patience and communication.

title: Operating Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Been trying  to apply for this place for 8 years since I graduated from here. Its really sad when even CSUN doesn't want to hire their own graduates on top of the general labor market.  I've only been invited to interviews twice. Each time took 60 days to get back to me to set up an interview since the job posting close date (initial review date).  They take a disrespectfully long amount of time before getting in contact. You may be pressured to hold off on other job interviews for other companies if good government benefits are important to you and you are desperately waiting for an interview request. 

Interviewers  asked very standard cookie cutter questions like they did a quick google search for them. Unfortunately, I only do well with questions where I can showcase my skills and its more open ended ("Why should I hire you?" , "What skills do you bring to the table?") instead of more close ended questions that warrant a more closed ended response ("How do you deal with difficult customers?", "Do you know x technology?").  I have my CCENT but haven't managed a network in over 3 years. Was asked a few technical networking questions where I froze and did poorly. 

Overall, CSUN is very selective for jobs that anyone with hands can do. This is a 6 months experience required job for goodness sake. But California's job market is among the most brutal and competitive of all the states and as long as there are desperate young guys like me willing to work for $30k-$35k, CSUN will always act like you owe them something.
Interview Questions: What is a subnet?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview, asked questions about my resume and my school schedule. It was a low stress interview and I was hired on the spot once my availability checked out with what they were looking for
Interview Questions: What's your major? When do you graduate? Can you use Word? What's your availability?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired immediately, to teach four classes, which is unusual as three is the norm. They needed someone who could teach in several areas, including speech, reading, and composition and ethnic studies.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very long application process - can take over a month. Questions are standard and asked to each interviewee. Interviewers often already know who they are giving the job to before the interviews even start.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at CSUN?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for the role of student assistant in the USU. The process took 2 weeks. Two rounds of interview. First round was phone and then in person.  Interview questions were expected and mostly behavioral
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Financial Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online
Phone screen with a panel (3+ people)
In-person panel interview

Unprofessionalism in the following up process. You are left wondering where you stand in the interview process until you see the job re-posted.
Interview Questions: How does your previous experience relate to this position?

title: Marketing Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. The questions were mostly focused on the previous experience. It was a very diverse group of panelist, and the questions were staring-forward. I applied for a Marketing Project Coordinator position and they asked me to do a 15 second commercial about why they should choose me for the position.
Interview Questions: What sort of direct marketing campaigns did you initiate?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: A simple one, one formal interview and a test to make sure you understand the sl=kills needed for the subject you will be tutoring. After the interview and the test, they let you know if you got the job.
Interview Questions: When are you graduating?

title: Student Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick Call - then had web interview.  It was an interview with 3-4 other advisers and then a solo interview with the main director. It was mainly basic questions regarding their rules/policies.
Interview Questions:
"Tell us about yourself" 
"How do you handle difficult situations with students"

title: Ticket Office Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Talked about goals, experience and classes currently taking.  The time it took was not too long and it was conducted outside since the ticket office is small.  There were two individuals who were a part of the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: How would you manage an upset customer?

title: LRC Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: It has pretty  awkward, There`s 3 interviewer with 15 questions.  All the interviewers are consist of students. It took months to reply even they said i get to know in 7 days.
Interview Questions: Are u able to multitask?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy. Just pure conversation. It was a short interview. Perhaps 5 minutes. It helped that I spoke Spanish. We mostly talked about the roles and responsibilities of the job. Interviewer was really friendly.
Interview Questions: Do you speak spanish

title: Energy & Sustainability Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions:
First round was a panel interview with 4 panelists.
The HR was especially rude - never replied to the questions I asked on the emails and was probably deliberately acting rude to avoid answering or simply harassing. I am extremely disappointed about the HR's behavior and am glad I don't have to work at a place where the people managing you are rude and non-cooperative.
Interview Questions: How I am a good fit for the position and what experience I have aligns with the position requirements

title: Student Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very basic interview questions, questions about the company and what they do to make sure you've done your research. At the end of the interview, they give you a worksheet with various scenarios to test your basic math skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Guest Service Team Member - Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Cashier and stock produces around the store and open and close the store with manger.  Deal with customers and provide customer service tasks and report to the manger or anyone higher up.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very good interview process. Initial interview was by phone. In person interview was by a panel of five people. Process took a long time to complete- over one month. Questions were average to hard.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Student Library Web Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume in, and was asked to schedule an interview after following up. The interview was pretty standard, in a relaxed and welcoming environment. I was interviewed by the Library's Web Programmer (my to-be supervisor), and his supervisor. I was given a list of the interview questions at the start.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with HTML/CSS/Javascript?

title: Service Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, I received a call for an interview. Then, one on-site Interview which goes on for about an hour where they ask you about your related experience. They ask you about customer management, working with team members etc.
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The job interview was a two-step process of finding individuals who had similar skill sets and placing them together. Once skill sets were categorized, then groups were made. After the group decision were decided, tasks were given out by the professor.
Interview Questions: What are your skill sets? Which fields of GIS are you most comfortable with?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Typical straight forward interview questions. Chiefly concentrated around supervising subordinate staff in a hostile environment. Questions also centered around tactics used to motivate employees and employee retention efforts in past employment.
Interview Questions: What training programs have you instituted

title: Membership Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: A few weeks after applying online, I received a phone call regarding the position I applied to and was offered an interview later that week. When I went in for an interview, I was introduced by one of the managers that worked at the SRC. He then informed me that he would not be the only one interviewing me. There were three more interviewers as I walked into the room. I greeted each of them one by one, and they proceeded to take turns asking me questions. Afterwards, I was then allowed to ask them any questions. They then informed me that they will let me know within the next three weeks whether I got the position or not.
Interview Questions: What is good customer service?

title: Reservation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with my direct supervisor. The interview wasn't about anything technical because of the simplicity of the job, but rather about what the supervisor thinks of you as a person. If you want a job just show that you can effectively communicate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: This is a whole day process, and I was scheduled for a teaching demonstration, research talk, and lunch and reception with the faculty and students from the department. People are friendly, and the campus is good. But the whole-day interview is just a bit tiring.
Interview Questions: A lot of questions in a panel meetings.

title: Meeting Room Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Receive a call which invites you to an interview. The interview is done in a panel which usually involves the supervisor and two or more employees who have been working there for some time. Questions are behavioral, customer service and time management related.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake and how did you address it

title: Student Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: The interview panel consisted of 2 staff members and 2 student assistants. They asked questions about my strengths and weaknesses, how i plan on overcoming them. They asked how i will benefit from this job. They also asked what i know about their company. they were writing notes as they interviewed me and asked me to define certain terms.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness of yours and how will this job help you overcome it?

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: It was a good one. Robert was very understanding and flexible with schedules. I enjoyed being a mentor for Math department during my tenure with them. I worked there for 2 years.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the job in math department.

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and informal interview. Basic competence and really just screening to see  if you would fit in with the vibes of the office. i.e are you friendly, have a sense of humor ,etc.
Interview Questions: Can you provide a schedule?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was based on class participation and past projects done during bachelors and various CAD courses and other programs learnt till that particular time. Even the employee communication and projects were reviewed during the selection process.
Interview Questions: About previous academic works done

title: Accounting Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds for the interview.  First was the phone interview and the second one was in person interview.  They asked me about behavioral and situational questions.  I am still waiting for the results.
Interview Questions: what do you expect from an employer?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It was good. I was asked questions about my past jobs and stress handling in work.
They scheduled a meeting and i went for interview. It took 15 days to get a reply from the department and i got offer letter then filing the ssn took another two weeks and then as i got my ssn i started working
Interview Questions:
What was your past experience ? 
Where and what did you work? 
How stressful it was ? 
How did you deal with the work pressure ? 
Are you good at dealing with new international students?

title: Instructional Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The manager was very polite. asked basic questions, the entire process took about an hour. The interview was easy. Basic questions like what is your experience with computers and photoshop and excel.  Overall a good experience. Definitely the best place to work for a part time job.
Interview Questions: what is your experience with computers? and photoshop

title: Box Office Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: First round was a Panel interview with 3 executives. After that they picked 3 candidates to move on to the final round were you interview with the director. After that, I have no idea bc I was not selected.
Interview Questions: Most questions were scripted and contained multiple questions within each asking. The executives took turns asking the questions. Once u answered they just accepted your answer and did not probe any deeper.

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Received call from Human Resources to schedule interview.  Personal interview with team and supervisor.  Appropriate questions.  Professional and pleasant experience.  Respectful and kind to candidate.  Efficient.
Interview Questions: Job specific qualifications.  Years of experience in duties directly pertaining to opening. Asked for examples/specific experiences related to job duties.

title: IT Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard process with initial phone/skype interview.  2nd round was an all day on campus interview with different groups and a campus tour. Final interview was a phone conversation with the leadership.  Very professional and collegial.  The goal was to understand the campus culture and needs and have them learn about the candidate.
Interview Questions: Questions all centered around operations, planning, development methodology and staff development.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email initially after submitting my application and resume through the organization website. I was then called in for an in person interview that consisted of standard questions regarding my experience and others about office procedures. After the interview I received an email informing me that I was being offered the position by the department coordinator.
Interview Questions: The interview was easy for the most part, but the most difficult question was having to walk the coordinator through my design process. It's nothing you shouldn't expect from a design position interview obviously.

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous interview process, involving review of former education, professional experience and classroom approach. Was done with the chair of the department as well as the head of the department subject.
Interview Questions: How would you discipline a delinquent student?

title: Student Support Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions:
The problem with this company, and other public universities at least, is their extremely shady hiring process: they often times already have a strong, internal candidate in mind (already working at CSUN) yet they need to "open" the position to outside applicants. In the process, they bring in numerous applicants for interviews knowing full well that they have almost no chance of getting the job. It's sad to see people apply, take the trouble to interview, and anxiously await a position they have zero chance of getting in the first place.

Also, there's a ton of nepotism here. The number of staff related to other staff is staggering. Just look up the names and a lot of times same last names actually mean relation.
Interview Questions: "why do you think you'd be good for this position?"

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very straight forward if you have the qualities required most likely you will get the job. Just be yourself and make sure you come prepared. Bring a printed resume for review.
Interview Questions: there is no difficult questions.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application in person and was called within a week. They asked me general interview questions as well as behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
You were asked if you have had any experience with customer service, or anything relative to it.
Also how you may be an asset to the office.
Express who you are, and where you want to be and learn from this experience
Interview Questions: Express who you are, and where you want to be and learn from this experience

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for my major, I was able to walk in and ask to apply. They then asked for resume credentials and available times. The interview process was simple and was very low tensions. More so it felt like the employer was trying to get to know you and your interest rather than trying to see if you were qualified or not.
Interview Questions: What field of your major interest you ?

title: Peer Learning Facilitor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the director of the program and she like me. She is an amazing person and I enjoyed the interview. Be prepared to know about being a PLF and the responsibility it entails.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the PLF program

title: Student Assistant Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: They called me up 3 weeks after I applied for the position. I seriously thought they didn't consider me because they got back to me a little late. The manager emailed me to set up an interview and apologized for getting back to me quite late. There were two interviewers and both of them asked behavioral type of questions. They are interested in the contents of my resume so I had to discuss to them what I wrote down and elaborate on it.
Interview Questions: How well do you know HTML?

title: Chief of Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: HR Recruiter called me to schedule interview with search committee, if I was liked there would be a on-campus interview.  Position is listed open until filled.  It has been one month and no word of whether I was screened in or screened out for the position.  I am being offered other positions elsewhere and would like this if given to me.  When I contacted HR they said they are still in the screening process and could not tell me more because of confidentiality. Was not informed of process.
Interview Questions: No real difficult questions. All were open ended.

title: Service Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: simple face to face interaction with instances give.. mainly emphasized on working in a group and cooperating with all irrespective of work pressure
Interview Questions: nothing difficult since all based on practical experience which can be correlated to everyday life

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online. Got called within a week for an interview. The interview consisted of questions that have to do with your resume. An example can be your past experiences working a job or activities you have done in the past. Interview lasted about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Questions on how to handle a certain situation.

title: Citrix Administrative Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: 2 Phone interviews
Interview Questions: Questions were all downloaded from internet

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge
Interview Descriptions: When you interview at CSUN they are very concerned that everyone gets equal treatment so for each job there is a committee that puts together questions. Everyone gets asked the same questions in the same way. Your interview is with the committee and they go around the table and each person in turn reads a question from the list.
Interview Questions: My questions were easy.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: They were three group interviews that were about two hours a piece over the span of three weeks and then a one on one interview on the fourth week.
Interview Questions: What was one experience where you experienced adversity?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Usually 4 people interviewing you. 1-2 student assistants plus immediate supervisor and manager. Dress to impress! No jeans please. There is about 10 questions. You answer, we write it down. ( I was able to interview my successor). Please dont be late. Have your references typed and ready to hand over to the hiring supervisor. Dont hand write it.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you know about the Union?

title: Usher At the Valley Performing Arts Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by upper management and at the time, VPAC was only two years old so they did not have a person specifically to interview the applicant. It was pretty easy and not very intimidating because the interviewer know that applicants are all students so they helped me a bit when I got stuck on a question. The interview lasted about 15 minutes and it was mainly about the responsibilities of the job rather than asking me how I qualify for the job. By the end of the interview, I was informed that I will be doing some paperwork in order to legitimately get the job.
Interview Questions: What previous experience did you have with customer service that would help you with this job?

title: IT Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview with the hiring manager.  An in-person panel interview with all of the IT Management team.  A final "meet and greet" interview with the CIO.  The phone interview lasted about an hour.  The panel interview was more than two hours.  The CIO interview was about 15 minutes.  I had to return on a separate day to meet the CIO.
Interview Questions: All the questions asked in the interview were prescripted.  The interviewers read from a page.  They were all standard questions.  You can probably search online for the "top ten interview questions" and get at least half of the questions asked in the panel interview.

title: Computer Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Professional troubleshoot related questions that analyzing decision making. A test of computer knowledge is also done. Questions about your greatest strengths and weaknesses are asked. Experience in microsoft office is also tested out.
Interview Questions: What do you do when a patron has already has been warned about lab policies, yet continues to break them?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Took a full day and met with personnel committee, college chair and Dean.  Started at 8am and ended at 8pm. Went to lunch with some faculty.  Everyone was really nice in the process. Also taught a sample class and answered questions by students.
Interview Questions: Background. Reason for applying

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview held by both departmental leaders. A little intimidating, but friendly. Asked basic questions about class schedule and how you would react in certain situations in the office.
Interview Questions: How will you manage being a student while working?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in June - called for interview one week after the job closed (job description included the date that the job would close and review would begin).  Had one interview with panel of three interviewers who alternated asking questions.  Since I already work elsewhere on campus they called me the next day to tell me that I didn't get the job.  If I didn't work on campus they probably would not have told me anything (a friend applied on campus last year and she never heard back).  In my particular case, though, there was a second level of interviews (with the big boss) for two people scheduled for the next day, so it would have been obvious I wasn't chosen if they didn't call me.
Interview Questions: how have you dealt with a past employee who was performing poorly?

title: Assistant Vice President Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: CSUN used a recruiting agency. Applications accepted online at CSUN's site. Recruiter did initial screening and preliminary interviews via phone (30 days later) and on SKYPE video (15 days later).  Recruiter made preliminary recommendation to search committee. Search committee of 5 members plus an HR representative did in-person, on site interview that lasted approximately 90 minutes. (30 days after recruiter interview.) Invited to campus for full day of interviews one week later. Met with 5 different groups, 2 members of search committee who were present in 2 of the groups, hiring manager and president in 1:1s. People pleasant, professional. President is fantastic, tremendous leader.
Interview Questions: None of the questions asked were difficult or unexpected.

title: Exchange Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California State University, Northridge (Northridge, CA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with CSU-Northridge Windows and Unix Systems Administrator as well as Systems Team Leader. Technical Questions, past experience, strengths and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: Unix questions for an Exchange Administrator?
